page.title: 13CHANGE IN HARDWICK
page.content: After the 1939-1945 war the soldiers were given a bit of land and a railway carriage.The only way to get water was by the pump.The soldiers used to collect the water in buckets and drag it home.Not only no water but there was no electricity or gas either.The oldest houses are mostly down Hall - Drive.Since the 1939 - 1945 war lots of cramped ugly houses have been built .Not only have the houses changed but the amount of people in Hardwick has too.In 1945 there was 120 people living in Hardwick.The village has changed alot since then.There are now about 1750 people that live in Hardwick .The village used to be a few houses and fields. There used to be four roads in Hardwick now there are over 50 in the housing estates. Hardwick houses nowadays all look the same.
